basics.name: Yi Yang Tan
basics.label: Software Engineer
summary: Analytical, creative, persistent and team-oriented software engineer with 3 years of professional experience writing code for web, mobile apps, mobile games and data science.
Love learning new and upcoming technologies such as machine-learning, blockchain tech and virtual reality
Hobbies include building fun websites and trying out projects on the Raspberry Pi.

work.summary: Work as a developer in a 30 strong team of engineers and UI/UX designers as part of GovTech, where we do weekly production release of our app (Moments of Life). Adhere to scrum practices and test-driven development in order to adapt to changing requirements while maintaining code quality.
highlights: Utilizing BLE(Bluetooth Low Energy) beacon technology, developed a showcase feature of our app for new users to download and explore an exhibition area with beacons placed throughout the venue.
Developed a CMS(Content Management System) for stakeholders of our app to publish and unpublish articles and events on our app, after proper validation.
Migrated backend services from a different commercial cloud onto the AWS platform, which required complete refactoring of authentication handling, web cookies and redirection handling.

education.area: B.A. in Economics, Minor in Computer Programming

awards.title: 2017 ASA DataFest Award: Best Use of Statistical Models
awards.summary: Headed a team of 5 students, using hierarchical clustering, we categorized 1 million rows of user data provided from Expedia into 5 major consumers groups. Based on their purchasing habits by month and day, we made recommendations to Expedia on how they could increase revenue by targeted advertising
